za.co.neilson.sqlite.orm

Class DatabaseModel<R,C>

  • java.lang.Object
    • za.co.neilson.sqlite.orm.DatabaseModel<R,C>
  • Type Parameters:
    R - The type of the result collection returned by a query. Android Returns a Cursor Object whilst JDBC returns a ResultSet
    C - The type of the result collection returned by a query. The type of map used to map column names to column values. Android requires the use of a ContentValues object whilst JDBC simply uses a HashMap

    public abstract class DatabaseModel<R,C>
extends java.lang.Object
    The base class for a DatabaseModel
    Since:
    0.1
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    Sheldon Neilson

      • onCreateDatabaseInfoModel

        public abstract ObjectModel<DatabaseInfo,R,C> onCreateDatabaseInfoModel()
                                                                 throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                                                                        java.lang.NoSuchFieldException
        Returns:
        A concrete subclass of ObjectModel for the DatabaseInfo class as the type of driver in use is unknown, the ObjectModel implementation must also be supplied by the concrete DatabaseModel subclass
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        java.lang.NoSuchFieldException
        Since:
        0.1

      • onInitializeDatabaseDriverInterface

        protected abstract DatabaseDriverInterface<R,C> onInitializeDatabaseDriverInterface(java.lang.Object... args)
        Parameters:
        args - An optional list of arguments to pass to your implementation of onInitializeDatabaseDriverInterface that you might require to instantiate your driver.
        Returns:
        the DatabaseDriverInterface connection used by this model. The DatabaseDriverInterface connection is instantiated internally. The databaseDriverInterface file connected to is determined by the getDatabaseName() method.
        Since:
        0.1

      • getDatabaseDriverInterface

        public DatabaseDriverInterface<R,C> getDatabaseDriverInterface()
        Returns:
        the DatabaseDriverInterface connection used by this model. The DatabaseDriverInterface connection is instantiated internally. The databaseDriverInterface file connected to is determined by the getDatabaseName() method.
        Since:
        0.1

      • getObjectModels

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.reflect.Type,ObjectModel<?,R,C>> getObjectModels()
        Returns:
        HashMap<Type,ObjectModel<?>> the ObjectModels registered to this DatabaseModel
        Since:
        0.1

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getDatabaseName

        public abstract java.lang.String getDatabaseName()
        The getDatabaseName() method must be overridden to supply a unique name for the database. This name returned by this method wil be used as the database file name
        Parameters:
        objectModels -
        Since:
        0.1

      • getDatabaseVersion

        public abstract int getDatabaseVersion()
        The getDatabaseVersion() method must be overridden to return the database version number. Future changes in this number will result in a call to onUpgrade() during DatabaseModel instantiation. database file name
        Parameters:
        objectModels -
        Since:
        0.1

      • connect

        public void connect()
             throws java.sql.SQLException
        Opens a connection to the database via the DatabaseDriverInterface. If the connection is already open calling this method will have no effect.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        Since:
        0.1

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Returns the connected state of the DatabaseDriverInterface to the database.
        Since:
        0.1

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Close the DatabaseDriverInterface's connection to the database.
        Since:
        0.1

      • onCreate

        protected void onCreate()
                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        Called if the specified database file does not exist during the instantiation of the DatabaseModel. This method creates the database file, tables for the objects mapped by the DatabaseModel as well as the DatabaseInfo table and calls onInsertDefaultValues()
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        Since:
        0.1

      • onUpgrade

        protected void onUpgrade(int previousVersion)
                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Called if an increase in the databaseVersion number is detected during the instantiation of the DatabaseModel. By default this method drops the databases tables and recreates them. Override this method to alter this behaviour and to insert any default records required.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        Since:
        0.1

      • onCreateDatabaseInfoTable

        protected void onCreateDatabaseInfoTable()
                                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Creates the DatabaseInfo table and initializes it with database version, created date and last accessed date information
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        Since:
        0.1

      • onInsertDefaultValues

        protected abstract void onInsertDefaultValues()
        Called after DateBaseModel.onCreate() or DateBaseModel.onUpdate() have completed. Override this method to insert any default records required into the databaseDriverInterface.
        Since:
        0.1
